item.title: Avoid using else statements
item.description: Let’s take a simple example from the world of JavaScript, where we can’t be certain of the type of a variable up front. Let’s say we have a function (myFunction) which we can either pass a string or an array of strings. If we pass it a string, we want to do something with that string. If we pass it an array, we want to do the same thing for each element in the array.

item.title: Whole Value Pattern
item.description: The Whole Value Pattern is a pattern first described by Ward Cunningham in 1994. It simply implies that a value should always be stored together with its corresponding unit, which together forms a “whole value”. A lone numerical value is usually not meaningful on its own, without a corresponding unit, and is therefore a violation of this pattern. The main benefit of following the Whole Value Pattern is that implicit developer knowledge can be made explicit in the codebase instead.
